COURSE DESCRIPTION

This course aims to prepare students to use English in business settings and to discuss selective business-related topics. Relevant terminologies and patterns will be introduced and practiced in each class meeting. Students are expected to use four skills to participate in a variety of in-class activities, including the discussion and role-play. In the end of this course, students will be asked to work on a group proposal with clear and persuasive language.

PROPOSAL: I want to run a \_\_\_\_\_\_ shop/business! (3-5 people in one group)

Description: Imagine that you want to start your own business. Many decisions have to be made, with a lot of investigation and research. You have to do research and decide, for example,

1.  what you want to sell or run,
2.  whether the shop is online, physical, or both,
3.  how many staff members you need, how you are going to recruit more workers, what will be prioritized in your job ad,
4.  what your individual group members are responsible for,
5.  how you are going to design the menu and to fix the price.

The list could go on and on.

Midterm Progress Presentation

The midterm progress presentation will cover essential elements of starting a business. Every student is expected to be responsible for a part of the proposal separately. NO written paper is required.

Final Proposal Presentation

This is the revised proposal. NO written paper is required.

Reviews: **Individual or pair, audio/video \[16+2 self-learning\]**

You are expected to do some research on the shop/business you want to run. Based on a problem you encounter while working on the proposal (for example, how to decide the location of a shop, how to set the price of your products),

1.  pick a reference or a theory (a book, a news clip, a video, or a commercial), such as the Big Mac Index, the IKEA effect, self-herding, and infomercials,
2.  introduce and summarize your reference to your classmates,
3.  note how the reference helps you to solve the said problem(s), and
4.  upload your audio/video as a YouTube video or an episode of podcast.
